name: 'H. Con. 172' Online Trivia | 'West Wing' - Season 3 | 10 Questions

questions.text: Leo told Jordan Kendall he wasn't easily intimidated.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Responding to that statement, Jordan said, "I am."

questions.text: What date was on the map that Charlie bought the President at the flea market?
questions.explanation:
1709.

	The map was hand colored with copper engraving, but didn't recognize Israel as a country so the President wasn't allowed to put it up in the Oval Office.

questions.text: Who did Josh go to when he wanted to find a way to meet Amy Gardner again?
questions.explanation:
Toby.

	Josh wanted to see Amy again, but he didn't have a reason to see her. Finally, in Toby's office they decided that Josh would take the paid leave act for mothers to Amy so Josh could get a chance to see her again. The meeting was interrupted by a phone call from Donna.

questions.text: Whose chapters of the tell-all book were mixed up when handed out to them?
questions.explanation:
Ed and Larry.

	A fired photographer that worked at the White House for a short time was going to put out a tell-all book. Sam got some of the staff together and gave them chapters so they could read and make comments. Larry said he saw one problem with the chapters: he had Ed's.

questions.text: Leo told Cliff, "I take a bullet for the President. He doesn't take one for me."
questions.explanation:
True.

	Cliff met with Leo and Jordan to work something out with the President so Leo wouldn't have to testify when the committee reconvened. Leo knew he was talking about a censure, and he made this remark to Cliff before walking out.

questions.text: Who told the President they live in the White House in January?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	The President asked Sam why he was still at work, and Sam made this comment to him.

questions.text: How many years have Leo and the President been good friends?
questions.explanation:
Eleven.

	Even though they've been good friends for eleven years, they've known each other for forty years.

questions.text: To whom did Josh say his IQ didn't break the bank?
questions.explanation:
Amy.

	Josh was explaining that he worked really hard in college so that he could do the job he was doing, and while he was doing that Amy was having a lot of sex with his roommate.

questions.text: Did the President accept the censure?
questions.explanation:
yes.

	The President decided to accept the censure while he was sitting outside with Leo. Josh told Leo that people got over being censured and Leo told him that this President wouldn't.

questions.text: At the end of the show, who was reading H.Con 172?
questions.explanation:
House Secretary.

	It was being recited as Leo and the President were sitting outside on the bench. The full speech is "Whereas in his conduct in the office of the President of the United States, Josiah Bartlet has engaged in a course of deceitful and dishonest conduct designed to impede and deny the disclosure of vital matters of public concern, the United States Congress hereby condemns him for acting in a manner contrary to his trust as President, and to great prejudice to the cause of justice, and to the manifest injury of the American people."
